department: Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions
description: The Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada has a requirement for the provision of customized bureau data from TransUnion.
full_summary:
**TransUnion Microdata Service**

The Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) is seeking the provision of customized microdata services from TransUnion. This Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) is a public notice indicating the government's intention to award a contract to a pre-identified supplier, TransUnion, providing an opportunity for other suppliers to demonstrate their capabilities.

**Scope of Requirements:**

The Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions requires a service provider to deliver microdata from TransUnion, including:

* Customized trade, client, and financial institution level data and analytics
* Ownership of trade, client, and financial institution level bureau data for the full suite of consumer loan products covering the period from 2008 onwards

**Preliminary Notice Details:**

* Contract Identification: PW-23-01026622
* Solicitation Number: 20222520
* Tender Closing Date: March 7, 2023 at 2:00 p.m. (EST)
* Contact Information: Craig Kenny, Senior Contracting Officer, Contracting@osfi-bsif.gc.ca, 255 Albert St., 12th Floor, Ottawa, ON K1A 0H2

**Additional Information:**

* This procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA).
* The proposed contract is for an initial period of two (2) years, with the option to extend for up to three (3) additional one-year periods.
* The estimated value of the contract, including option periods, is $1,450,000.00.

**Instructions to Suppliers:**

Suppliers who believe they can meet the requirements are invited to submit a statement of capabilities, demonstrating their ability to satisfy the specified requirements. Statements of capabilities must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority by the closing date and time of March 7, 2023 at 2:00 p.m. (EST). Enquiries regarding the statement of capabilities should be directed to Craig Kenny, Senior Contracting Officer. If no other supplier submits a suitable statement of capabilities, the contract will be awarded to the pre-selected supplier, TransUnion.
